caption: Amazing food but wouldn't be going as often as I want. Just extremely expensive for what the amount I get...

I used to love this spot but they are charging $8 for 8oz pours and making you buy $5-8 sides on top. My friend got a fancy munchkin with dipping cream for like $4. I dunno. Not worth it. I'd scout the menu before you go in to check the prices. If you can justify it, the food, beer selection and atmosphere are great. I just can't rate it higher because the prices are insane.
Ordered the whitefish tartine, highly recommend.

I really wanted to love this place. Maybe I went on an “off” night but it’s really just not worth going. First they told us to go to a table that was already in use. When we sat down at the empty table we thought they meant, the guy gets angry at us. We choose some cans of beer they sell chilled, can’t drink them here. Want separate tabs, can’t do it. It’s impossible. For one 8 ounce beer and a sandwich it was $93 for 3 people. The hot chicken is decent at best. If you’re craving Haddie B’s: this ain’t gonna cut it. Go somewhere else.
good rotating tap. porchetta sandwich is to die for
Great
Great sandwich
The staff is all above-and-beyond helpful and friendly, plus everything is delicious.
Get the deep fried babka bites.
Weird about buying beer and sitting down

Incredible selection of craft beers and upgraded bar food - great sandwiches, wings, tartines, etc. Yes, the food can be a bit pricey but it’s totally on par for the quality. The food is superb! Also, the bar/restaurant is in the back of a boutique grocery store which has a vast assortment of very unique food and alcohol - super cool. Love Mekelburg’s!
Haven't tried the food yet (not good for vegans but there are a few options) but an ultra cosy place with friendly staff, the best of the best in beer selection and inoffensive music levels.
A lot of speciality, hard to find products. I LOVE this place. It's easy to miss though!
Good

The food here is very good and so are the drinks. The only reason the review isnt higher is because this place is very overpriced. The soup is great, but is way overpriced and they only provide a tiny sliver of bread with it. Would be nice to see 3x as much bread when you pay that much for a soup. The tofu bahn mi is also very good, but at  $17 for a sandwich w few toppings, it's hard to justify the purchase. The staff is all nice. They also stop serving certain things from the menu after 3, which is frustrating. I tried to order a baguette with Jam at 3:30 and was turned down. Otherwise excellent food, just not a good bang for your buck and definitely overpriced

DON"T BUY THE GIFT CARD, ITS A SCAM. I've been a couple times over the years, and in 2020 received a gift card. The food is good, but overpriced, so having a gift card is nice. Sadly when I went to use my card the other day, it didn't work. Instead of sympathy or some level of problem solving, the guy who was "helping" me said it could be a number of issues like no money left on it (not true, I havent used it) or it was expired. BUT, there is nowhere on the card or the website or the store that mentions the gift card expires. At most I've had this card for a year. regardless, to have a card expire without any warning or written explanation of an expiration date seems like a scam to me. I mentioned this to the worker and he dismissed me while agreeing & then basically told me to get over it and offered me nothing in return. overall horrible experience & I wont be returning.

I’ve loved this place for years and it’s been great to see Mekelburg’s grow into their Wburg space.  The Clinton Hill location near me has excellent curated beer, grocery and their menu has always been so tasty and consistent.  I wanted to write a review bc...Friday I ate outside and took half of my sandwich to go.  When I came inside to pick up some groceries and pay my bill, I dropped my togo box and my sub ended up on the floor.  A tall guy behind the register came right over and helped - he was super kind about cleaning up my mess.  I would have never asked to replace a sandwich I dropped, but he asked the kitchen anyway.   When I got home I realized the kitchen had made me a whole new sandwich. I thought it was above and beyond my expectation and just another reason I love and support this solid neighborhood spot.
Great selection of groceries / drinks for last minute things — a bit pricey but that’s because the products they carry are high quality.
Service not the best but food was good just little to pricey for small portions of food
Great food, service is  s  l  o  w
Good coffe there
One of my favorite places in the world. Best beer list in the city, incredible sandwiches, great gourmet grocer, awesome people. Chocolate babka is the best I’ve ever had.

Mekelburg’s has some of the best sandwiches in Brooklyn, regardless of whether you eat them on the back patio or have them delivered. The beer selection is always top notch, and the babka are out of this world. Mekelburg’s chocolate babka has played a vital role in getting our household through the pandemic - for that I thank you. If you haven’t checked this one-of-a-kind institution out yet, do yourself the favor.
Love the hot chicken sandwich!
so nice a place

I really wanted to love this place. I have eaten at Mekelburg’s three times - the first time, they forgot about my sandwich and I waited 40 min after ordering to receive it, despite checking in periodically with the staff. They refused to admit that they had forgotten about my sandwich, even though the rest of the meal at my table had come out within 10 min.  Most recently, I ordered a hot drink to go at the bar, since they were advertising them out front. They gave me a small paper cup without a lid - when I requested either a larger cup or a lid so I could actually take the drink to go and not spill it on myself, they made me wait for 12 minutes inside the store while they looked around for a lid, only to tell me at the end that they had no lids or larger cups. It’s sad because they have good food but their service is unpredictable and illogical. If you come here, be prepared to wait a long time for a simple request, and without any expectation of a refund or apology for the inconvenience.

Placed an online order for pickup at 1:01pm.  The order was ready to be picked up at 1:38pm. When I got there at 1:45, I gave the person my name and order number. It wasn’t ready and I then waited another 45 minutes outside of Mekelburg’s until 2:30.  It turned out that they never called my name or the order number despite asking the person multiple times if my order was ready. It sat on the takeout counter the entire time that I was waiting. No apologies or anything while everyone who ordered after me got their orders and left.  The dude who gave me the bag wouldn’t listen to me and he was dismissive.
Great place to find great food

It's such a great environment. It's so underground... Literally!!! I love you aesthetics and the red tones and the workers there are some of the coolest nicest people in New York. The meal I got was Croque Meksiur. I thought it was decent but I will say the texture was a little to crunchy in my taste. I wasn't really a fan of the textures but the flavors were very savory. The pickles added a nice touch of sourness to it. If I were to ever go there again I'd definitely order something different.
Love the food
Bad service by one of the staff who was a young male. So rude. Will never go or recommend the place to anyone.

These guys have gone total greed. $9 drafts and additional $5 cork fee on cans they sell. Great beer selection but screw it you might as well go to the Food Emporium down the street for the craft beer. The Hot Chicken sandwich is the best I've ever had but $14 without even a side....  I've been a huge fan for years since i live next door but they've steadily gone down hill over the years. The greed is strong here. I won't be returning.  RIP
If you go here, say hi to Terrence and Nick. Best people
Super wet sandwich (not in a good way) and over dressed salad (dressing should come separate). If you want to spend $50 for a salad and sandwich delivered, go to court street grocers

Its Tuesday at 12:31 pm and the phone rings and rings..and rings.... Then voicemail comes in saying it's full. How do we place a pickup order?! I will tell all my friends NOT to bother with this place, very unprofessional to be a business and not even clear your voicemail. PS: only a subpar owner would blame his laziness on a pandemic that caused so much suffering. You can clear voicemail remotely I hear....

Been going to Mek's for a couple years now but the show is over...recent order for pickup goes over the est time, ask for time when will be ready and no response given "we don't know" - chef and crew didn't really seem to care. Unfortunately all the orders for last months at Mek have been taking forever to receive. They must be doing well and really don't care, so I'll give up on them also. Shame
(Translated by Google) Wow If you continue to eat here for 3 days, you will definitely gain 3 kg.  (Original) わーぁ ここで3日間食べ続けたら確実3キロ太りそうです
What’s the point of eating anywhere other than Mekelburg’s?
Nice back patio and great beer options
Mama’s Meatloaf sandwich is exceptional and the local craft brew selection always a treat.

I had the hot chicken sandwich, and my friends got some wings. That hot honey was so beautiful! It's a cute little place with a lot of really interesting groceries inside. I'm glad I got to check it out!
The words and pictures won’t do justice. Come visit.
Great selection of beer and you can mix and match from their fridge. This is a classy place with Brooklyn charm. Not so cheap, but worth the treat every now and then.
Food and service was great!

I came here yesterday (9/28/20) to get some homework done with my friend/roommate. The waiter asked to hold one of our cards if we were going to sit in the back (I found this weird to begin with because we weren't at a bar and we would be paying for our food/drinks at the very end anyway, but I gave them my card to hold onto despite my concerns). Fast forward to 9pm last night, there's a $1354 western union charge on my card. In the four years I've had my debit card I have never ever had to file a dispute or deal with any fraudulent charges, so it surely isn't a coincidence that in the four hours their employee had my card my checkings account was drained of $1354, most likely to western union themselves money from my account. This was by far the WORST experience I have ever had at any business in my life. I enjoyed the ambience here so much and planned to come back everyday until it gets cold, but this place disgusts me now. Please keep your employees in check because you're clearly hiring people who can't be trusted. Luckily I'll most likely be able to get my money back because I notified my bank immediately and they were very understanding, but I will still do my best to recover all the details regarding this western union transaction so that I can file a police report. If the manager/owner ends up reading this, the employee who held onto my card was a tall ish long brown haired white male with a slim build.
Best chocolate babka in New York. Food and beer is pretty good too, but haven't been back for indoor dining in a while obviously.
Worst restaurant I have ever been 😑😑 Quality of food was average. But the behavior of stuff was horrible. Its took 1 hour to make my 2 items food.
I thought it was over priced. And the beers, 13 bucks for a 16 oz. it cost me 100 bucks for lunch, and they forgot the chips.
Excellent salads & chicken wings
The best hot honey chicken I’ve had! I live within walking distance so I always order and go pick up. I also loveeee the lychee margarita.

Mek’s has not gone down hill, farbeit , great selection of local beers, good grocery selection and the duck banh mi, chicken sammies, porchetta etc all to die for. Sidewalk and garden dining and very friendly staff.

Oh Mekelburg’s... this breaks my heart. I think they’ve gone somewhat downhill in the past couple of years. This review is just for the food from the bar. I ordered the sesame kale salad and the hot chicken sandwich, which I had ordered before a few times (when I don’t order the pork sandwich). This time ordering was not great. The chicken sandwich was both dry and greasy, while the sauce was incredibly grainy and didn’t taste like the hot chicken sauce I had before from them. The salad was also really disappointing. As you can see, no sesame of any kind (well, there was a bit of sesame residue from something) and only a few sad carrots. The dressing was a balsamic vinaigrette, and the kale was very tough. You might say, well that’s just eating kale, but their sesame kale salad used to be fantastic. The kale was tender and perfectly dressed, and there were sesame croutons on top. For some reason, this wasn’t available and no one let me know this before delivery. I would have taken it off the order.  Which brings me to the kicker... these two items totaled to $35. I know, I know, this is Brooklyn, but if you’re gonna charge like this, it has to be perfect every time—I’ll gladly pay more for a fantastic salad and sandwich. Not so much for this. I’ve included a pic of the very sad salad
I tried this place before with my friend and I am obsessed since then. I liked the good atmosphere and flavorful dishes and beverages. 5 stars from me.
Be prepared for some rich food!
$15 for a tiny burger that didn't even come with fries what is this place?

EDIT: This review was for the Williamsburg location. Not quite sure how it got moved  Honestly torn on this place. Agonized for weeks before dropping in for the hot chicken sandwich. Prices had just gone up, so it was over $15 including tax for one sandwich which is high even for NYC. Had to wait 15 minutes, and the place seemed to be weirdly overstaffed (20 or so employees milling around, but maybe there was a meeting about something?). Grocery selection was sparse and prices were sometimes labeled, sometimes not. Great beer selection. Finally got the sandwich and it was a lot smaller than I was expecting for $15..... but then I got back to my office and inhaled the whole thing in about 2 minutes. INSANELY good - crunchy chicken, the right combination of spicy and sweet, great pickles and a delicious bun. My only complaint is that it was over too soon!  In the future I'll probably head to my local bodega for a 1/3 of the price when jonesing for a chicken sandwich. But Mekelburg's is probably worth it for a splurge meal - I just think that the next time I come here I'll try eating in and grabbing one of the awesome beers they have stocked instead of waiting for takeout.

To be fair, the food tastes good, they have really cool interior for a grocery store however, the food to order is quite overpriced. We ordered the first item on their sandwich menu at 11:30am in the morning when there was barely anyone in the store. They took 45 mins to prepare the sandwich when we were planning to get a quick takeout.. I understand that things can take long but they could just give us a warning about it, no word.. And after 45 mins of waiting under the sun outside I told the person who delivered the food that they could have at least told us that its gonna take a while and he just scoffed, turned around and walked back without saying anything. Like why would you not at least say that you understand us and you are sorry about it? Hope somebody from the spot reads this, it’s such a shame :(
Very cool place.  Kind staff.  Spicy chicken sandwich is on point.

Went here for the first time. Super cute grocer though very expensive items. But the frozen Margherita packed a punch for the price point! Little sweet but good flavor and strong. Outdoor seating on a chill block. Overall nice vibe
The best

Best hot chicken sandwich I've ever had.  Better than anything you can find in Nashville!  Prices were reasonable and they have a great selection of rotating beers on tap.  Groceries were quite expensive, but I guess that's to be expected for a specialty market.
I really like the food here and I usually order from here about once a month. Would recommend this spot to all my friends.
The best place in the neighborhood, and maybe the whole city!
You won't believe how crazy good their menu, but the prices are a bit up there. Totally worth it though, should really check this place out if you're debating.

In the words of the great Tina Turner: "You're simply the best! Better than all the rest!" The sandwiches here are super. They are on the pricey side as sandwiches go, but I've never had one I didn't like. They've also made a.sweet distant pandemic setting for outdoor sit down service. There is plenty of space between tables and all the staff wear masks and gloves. The other patrons seem to respect distancing as well. Hope to come back again soon for more treats.
The stuff rude.....not good
Is good place and the food is the amazing

Very rude staff, scoffed at a question and refused to substitute a different dressing. Laughed at my ask for an alternative dressing, and the salad is tiny. For $12 I expect slightly more, and far better service. This is the 3rd time the staff has been snarky and pretentious, will not be going back.
Food not ready at time 0000 star
No comment
Thank you guys for donating your delicious food to FDNY EMS Station 38. We appreciate your effort. You give us comfort in what is the most stressful time period of our careers. Much appreciated!
Love it
Cute diner tucked away behind the grocery section with delish sandwiches.
(Translated by Google) Simple, rich, cheap no  (Original) Sencillo, rico, barato no

This place is amazing!!! Lots of open space in this industrial style bar/cafe/deli/market concept space. Head to the bar and order a delicious citrus ipa and do not miss out on the hot chicken sandwich! It’s perfectly crunchy and flavorful. My whole table ordered them and all of us were satisfied. The outdoor seating is a plus.
The good food and drink is offset by the crowdedness and the fact that they never answer their phone!
Porchetta sandwich...drizzle some chili infused honey on it and prepare to weep with joy.👍🏻💪🏻
The chicken sandwich CAN compete!
mad tasty

We stayed at an Airbnb around the corner.  Dropped in for a drink after a day of sightseeing.  Great beer selection and nice low key vibe.  We went back again with the kids and ordered the porchetta sandwich.  It was amazing.  The only issue was my daughter ate too much of it.
Amazing hidden gem here in Clinton Hills.. Hot chicken sandwich is a must do... Friendly staff.
Best bar in NYC baby!
Great food 👌 Good shop for putting together a stinky dinner of meats and cheeses
weirdly waited for 30 minutes for a $15 baked potato. bad vibe 🤷🏼‍♂️
You walk into a small store and make your way into restaurant. Food was good and it was a nice atmosphere.
Sold out of items we wanted to order. Get there earlier next time.
Don’t come here hungry because by the time you get your food you’ll be famished.
Good food but takes literally forever. Not worth the wait. At times rude service
Nice lowkey vibe, if you want good food and ambience. Would recommend.
Chilled out family friendly space, with amazing selection of beer for mum and dad.

The bar is serves great drinks The food is delicious. The kitchen is totally disorganized--totally unacceptable delays between ordering and food delivery.  May be ok for Brooklynites, but not for other folks.
Fantastic beer selection!

Ok so originally only liked there baked patatoe but went a second time late looking for something to eat and they werent serving it at that time only this amazing chicken sandwitch that stole my heart and made me change my review. Love their staff special shot out to Kayla for the awesome and friendly service.
Hot chicken is good but there are better options on the menu.
Got the Porchetta about 20 min ago. Currently in food coma, can't move. 10/10 would eat again

Wow wow wow what a sammich. Sometimes things happen in a kitchen and an already slow thing is even slower. It happens. I've nothing to do for the afternoon, who cares? They apologized profusely and it was well worth the wait.  Porchetta sandwich was amazing. Had a taste of the mexchicken sammich; stupendous as well.
Really good quality in all they serve.

Just had a really frustrating experience at the cheese counter. No acknowledgement that I was there waiting for service, completely unfriendly, doing prep work instead of helping customers. I love the cheese selection but this level of service has me questioning whether I’ll go back.
Amazing burgers and beer selection!
Spicy chicken sandwich 100%
Good food at high prices.

(Translated by Google) We stopped by chance in this hidden bar restaurant at the bottom of a grocery store in Williamsburg and what a surprise! We took small tapas dishes, everything was really very good! A wide choice of draft beers is available. I recommend  (Original) Nous nous sommes arrêtés par hasard dans ce restaurant bar caché au fond d’une épicerie à Williamsburg et quelle surprise ! Nous avons prit des petits plats types tapas , tout était vraiment très bon! Un large choix de bières pression est disponible. Je recommande

Mekelburgs is my go to.  Not surprising though.  I get preferred seating here and it’s not uncommon for me to receive a standing ovation as I stride in walking up to my reserved seat and then indulging in an ice cold drink.  The beers are cold, the Fireball flows abundantly and the food is excellent.  I spend thousands here annually and it’s a privilege and an honor to be customer of the month for 9 straight months.  TYFYS
My first bar in NYC - awesome people, cozy backyard, good beer selection, and hot chicken.
Best baked potato this side of Ormskirk

This spot can be a bit overwhelming at first, but the staff was more than happy to help out. Work your way to the back of the store and you’ll find a nice dwelling place with a full bar and plenty of tables for seating.  The beer selection at the bar is top notch and the food is sure to leave you feeling full and satisfied.  I hope I can spend some more time here in the future to experience all that they have to offer.
Always friends service and great food and drinks. The shop has so many interesting things you won't find at other places. Crowded but always a good time.
Hot chicken sandwich and a huge beer list. What more could you want.
Nana’s Meatloaf is a must!
The beer selection and the hot chicken were amazing!!!! I'm also a fan of their pints to go.
Super expensive for very small portions. Not at all tasty. The cinnamon & chocolate bread was good but here again very pricey
Smoked black cod, mek n cheese, babka popper, Galaxy Pop sour..I had the perfect birthday here. Delicious food, normal prices, incredible service.
Friendly staff great food.

Great food, beer/wine selection, and cocktails. Mini store upfront is pricey, but there if you need it. TVs with audio are at the bar. Back patio is available. While people bring their kids here, I don’t think it’s necessarily a kid-friendly place all the time (can get really loud and boisterous). Bartenders are good and know their stuff.

Lol, I'll keep it simple. You get to come here and eat all the things.  From the chicken sandwich to the chocolate babka, just eat everything that sounds remotely appealing to you.  The beer selection is also excellent and robust and the cherry on top is that the place is open late!  So what're the cons? The place is expensive. Like Manhattan expensive and portion sizes are a bit small. The seating is limited and sometimes the music straight up SUCKS (it was thrash metal today for some godforsaken reason)  At the end of the day though. Pros far far outweigh the cons. Once you try the food, you'll understand.
the world’s best hot chicken sandwich. hands down.
Delicious sandwiches and craft beer but SUPER pricey...

Pricey but amazing. This is the kind of place that you hope it to be. It feels like it belongs in Primrose Hill in London where Wall Street/city types come by for their freshly baked baguettes and overly priced cheeses. They bring their perfectly coiffed little ones who imbibe the smells and paw the weird hand coffee grinders/exotic teas.. Everything in the store looks like it was handpicked for quality and it is simply awesome. I have never eaten in the back but its on my to do list. Wonderful neighborhood find-you just need a fat wallet!
I love $18 sandwiches with pieces of plastic, rude staff and yuppies! The best is when you do a takeout order, you get the wrong order and the staff don’t apologize.
Oh yeah!
Fantastic beers, good food
A surprise find near Pratt. Do a little shopping, grab a quick meal and a drink. Don't leave without buying a chocolate or cinnamon babka.
Very much overpriced for the food quality it offers
Hot Chicken sandwich is hot!!!!
Great idea with the bar inside a shop!! And very tasty food!
Oh my god.
Great sandwiches and variety of beers

(Translated by Google) The site is a secret corner that is good to know, they have handmade breads, and the atmosphere is pleasant.  (Original) El sitio es un rincón secreto que es bueno conocer, tienen panes artesanales, y el ambiente es agradable.

Just amazing sandwiches. And a craft beer selection worth walking too. Nestled in the back of a gourmet grocery, with a nice little patio outdoor space in the back. Porchetta and Meatloaf sandwiches are amazing...
The veggie sandwich is amazing. Pricy groceries, but as long as you’re just picking up specialty items, worth it! Love the sourdough bread they stock here.
Best porchetta sandwich ever. Best baked potato ever. Best everything. Open late, friendly service, prices average for the neighborhood. Go.
Delicious sandwiches
Excellent products very knowledgeable staff whatever they don't have they could order for you very courteous people mom-and-pop type atmosphere

Great selection of items in the market. I feel like they sell all the things I want in my dream kitchen. The bar in the back serves great food all day and there is outdoor seating and hour restrictions on when you can use laptops. Everything I’ve tried is great, but I really loved the duck pate with everything baguette slices.
Super awesome New York experience. Little deli/grocery by say and bar serving unique local beers and creative food by night.
We went for a beer, it’s a nice little basement style spot. Feels secret, and safe. The sandwiches look really good.
Sublime food served late and very solid beer selection, especially if you remember to check the can and bottle list.
Nice place!
AMAZING spicy chicken sandwich!!!
It's super chill,good vibez, amazing bartenders  (tasha,mj,chris) and you gotta try the chicken sandwich

While I think everyone that works here is lovely, I have to admit its a bit whats wrong with Brooklyn these days. almost 20 dollars for a sandwich, and after half an hour (it wasn't terribly busy, I'm afraid to say) it was decent, but not even close to being worth the price nor the wait. the specialty items they sell are lovely, but dually ridiculously priced (eg. 10 dollars for peanut butter) , and while the selection is varied, the brands e.g. Bonne Maman you can simply buy elsewhere for half the ticket. The waitress and bartender could have been better to my friend and her infant-who was crying, well, because its an infant. We, too, spent 60 dollars on 3 sandwiches like the other yuppies around us.  And that's brooklyn. Pretty interior. Cool people. Zero uniqueness left. only the look of it.
This place is worth visiting. They serve large portions for affordable rates. Constantly clean and with great character. Would recommend to others.
Nonna's meatloaf sandwich and amazing beers. Love this place
Just looking will go back soon
So dope
amazing food
Great beer selection
Hidden deli surprise. Nice spot to have lunch! My co-workers are addicted and order from Mekelburg’s daily.

This place is such a neighborhood treasure.  Walked by yesterday and they had a quartet going with a cello randomly outside playing beautiful music.  To start, they have GRAETERS ICE CREAM, if you haven't had, get the black raspberry chip, you will not regret it.  The grocery store has all the fine upscale items you need for a picnic/meat & cheese plate to blow your friends away.  The bar in the back is the perfect addition that feels "speakeasy-esque", without the pretentiousness of those Manhattan speakeasies.  Amazing beer selection, dat hot chicken sandwich tho..., and fun board games to play late into the night!
Must try the spicy MekChicken! Served only after midnight

Great beer selection and a fine food area where you can have also a range of cheeses to buy or to  try in the bar. Nice beergarten in the backyard and great atmosphere. The draft beer options make this place a top spot in Brooklyn
Food is generally excellent, and beer selection is good. But the service is kind of terrible. Friendly, but very slow… Seemingly chronically understaffed And is not particularly efficient.

What can I say that hasn’t been said? A Clinton Hill and Brooklyn treasure. High quality food and beer selection. Seems the entire establishment takes excellence seriously at every level. Try the porchetta or meatloaf sandwiches. And the beer of course, but hurry, the craft beer selection seems to rotate frequently. Fantastic!
Hipster gem behind a high end convenience store/farmer's market. Drink specials, small glasses available, upscale pub sandwiches, baked potatoes with the works

Bar is in the back. The entire bar menu, both food and drink, is on the wall behind the bar. 16 bars on draft.  There is a lunch special that is not on the board, it is on the piling in the center if the bar. I got the 'Italian' sandwich and enjoyed it. 5 tables with 4 seats at each. Did not venture much into the store in the front.

Overall, Mekelburg's is a nice place to hang out with friends on a Saturday afternoon. Owing to it's popularity it can get a little crowded and noisy so you may want to go during "non-peak" times. The drink menu has a well catered variety. The food is overall tasty with enough uniqueness to each dish that you may find yourself ordering a little more than you need out of sheer curiosity.
Great priced local food and craft beer. Amazing little artisinal grocery store.
Great beer and food.
Hidden gem in the neighborhood. First time ordering the pork sandwich with the broccoli rabe. Delicious!! Love this place.  Always great!
I want one of these in our neighborhood.  Excellent sandwiches, great beers, a market.  Totally worth a visit.
Good food and beer selection

This is the neighborhood bar I take out-of-towners to because the food is always good, the bartenders are sweet without lacking personality, everything's always clean, and people love telling other people they went to a bar in the back of a grocery store.

This is a fine establishment, everything about this place is top notch. The beer selection is exceptional with a wide range of beer variety, these guys do their research when selecting their beers. The $5 happy hour is pretty amazing with select beers, can’t beat that happy hour. The sandwiches are equally amazing as the beers and service. Would highly recommend.

DO NOT order food gifts for shipping on line. Items never shipped. Impossible to reach anyone by phone and email. I don't care how good the product is if it doesn't arrive in time for a 91 BD party (ordered 10 days in advance!) They claim items were shipped 3/21 (although ordered 3/13.) TO DATE, as of 4/4 NOTHING HAS BEEN RECEIVED. SCAM.
What an amazing New York deli experience...
Always tasty fresh food and a good beer menu.
Amazing sandwiches!
I bought a veggie sandwich from here. The sandwich was delicious.
A bit overpriced, but good food. Awesome space.
Good selection of beer. Nice place to bring a party
This is a really cool place for a quick beer and a bite. Food is good, beer selection is better. I love that the front is a store... just walk to the back!

Delicious sandwich (and baked potato!) options alongside a sturdy list of beers in a comfortable, effortless bar space. The grocery store at the front appears browse-worthy but posh. Weekday trivia nights seem promising but can get tedious at over 2 hours long (instead of simple rounds of questions, they have an unnecessarily complicated system that takes some of the fun and frivolity of trivia out of the picture).
Hands down my favorite bar.  A super laid back bar with friendly bar tenders and a great beer list.

(Translated by Google) AWESOME ! This bar with the first appearance of a delicatessen allows everyone to find themselves in a super cozy atmosphere neither saturated nor too calm. The after midnight chicken sandwiches are excellent. Do not hesitate to ask for advice on beers.  (Original) GÉNIAL ! Ce bar aux premières allures d'épicerie fine permet à tout un chacun de se retrouver dans une ambiance hyper cosy ni saturée ni trop calme. Les sadnwichs au poulet d'après minuit sont excellents. Ne pas hésiter à demander conseil pour les bières.
Hot Chicken Sandwiches. Hot Chicken Sandwiches. Hot Chicken Sandwiches.
Great food and drinks. Nice local spot.
Great beer selection, but the food is pretty hostile to vegetarians. The Sichuan peanuts are pleasantly numbing though.
Good to visit for food & groceries

In the front of the house is a gourmet deli and grocery. Head to the back of the house for an extensive eclectic $$$ beer list by the various sized glass, top notch sandwiches, other things on which to nosh and board games on offer. Summers the back porch is open. Happy hour weekday's until 8pm.
Their food never disappoints! Love their veggie sandwich and the shrimp po boy is delicious! They are pricy but worth it! #vegetarianfriendly #happyhour #romantic #datenight #healthy

1. Great market for cuts of meat, cheese and fine produce, dry goods!  2. Insane beer selection on draft and in bottle/can  3. Delicious snacks and amazing sandwiches (and a late night sandwich that rules them ALL)  4. Great bartenders and shopkeepers  5. Refill-able soap and detergent dispenser for reducing the amount of plastics we dump in landfills!  Truly a neighborhood staple!
Pretty awesome bodega with craft brew and great chicken sandwiches in the back.

I spent my pre birthday evening here , it was probably one of the best fried chicken sandwiches I've, it was like a fried chicken sandwich, body slammed a BLT and afterword said, I am a better sandwich. My mouth agreed , then I slept .
Go after 12am to have one of the best burgers. Perfectly spiced and cooked. Also a nice place to come grab food after a night out.
I love this place! Amazing atmosphere and incredible selection of NY and microbrews!

Very relaxed, with an excellent rotating beer selection and great food. Nana’s meatloaf is life; mekmuffins for breakfast are amazing. Backyard is super chill. Store is expensive but fun to poke around. my first choice for places to hang in Clinton Hill.
If you've been here then you know this place is legit. Also, their lunch special is the best.
Great beer selection and the food  and service was great.
Always ready for a hot chicken sandwhich
Very good place.
Great neighborhood spot with very good food.

It’s unreal how good Mekelburgs is. I go here way too often. I’m addicted to their hot chicken that they only serve after midnight on the weekends. I look forward to it all week. Yes, I have a problem.
Great staff, great beer, great food. They even gave me free pumpkin pie so it's hard not to fall in love.

Embodiment of convivial bon-vivanterie. I love the roast beef sandwich, the crab BLT, the caviar amd smoked cod baked potato and the weird craft brews. I also love the trivia night on Tuesday. It is never too loud and I pretty much adore everything about this gem of beer cave, from the bartenders to the shrimp poboy.
The food and beer choice is great! Will be back soon in August!!
Gr8 place for a late night snaack.Love this place easy on the seasoning and make that chicken burger an all day thing and you'll be 5 stars. I like it better during the week when it's less crowded.
Great food and beer selection!

Staff wasn't the friendliest tonight. I've had better experiences, before. And esp even mtg the owner who was beyond nice a few weeks ago at their other grand opening in Williamsburg. I'll reserve being too harsh, considering the late timeframe.

Enter Mekelburg's and you may be wondering whether you're in the right place because it'll look like you're in a grocery store (and you are) but sure enough, push through towards the back and you'll find what I can best describe as a speakeasy sandwich shop / bar. The food is pretty satisfyingly comforting and there's a large selection of beers on tap. There's also a backyard for when the weather is nice. Overall a great place to meet friends, grab a bite, a drink and hang out.
This place just hits it out of the park with everything they make. My personal favorite's are the salt potatoes and the porchetta sandwich. Great beer and wine selection as well.
Amazing place. Most delicious baked potatoes, great local beer, super cozy and cute
Super cool place with amazing local food

If you’re walking Grand Ave off of Clifton and knew nothing of this spot, you’d probably pass right by it. There are a few stairs going to basement level of what appears to be a grocery store on Grand that leads to Mekelburg’s and if you glanced through the glass door without going inside, you’d think this was a preppy hippy grocery store. If you walk past all the gourmet and specialty products, boom! Just like that you’re in a hidden bar(not so hidden anymore because of all the reviews and write ups)with a nice quaint backyard with a great food and beer lineup. Absolutely one of my favorite spots to grab a beer and grub with some friends. The Mac and cheese, wings, the samba roasted oysters, the duck banm mi! It’s all so damn good! Get everything!
Great beers and sandwiches.
ALL of the sandwiches are it of this world. Great hot sauce selection too!
Oysters, mac-n-cheese.  Eclectic grocery goods up front.
Unbeatable!! Amazing local spot
Truly the best breakfast sandwich I’ve ever had.
Great food great beer but much more expensive than other bars in the neighborhood
(Translated by Google) ❤️beer  (Original) ❤️beer
Awesome beer selection that's always rotating. Tasty fresh food. Come in and get your beer geek on.
The best Chicken Burger ever! Try the MekChicken
Fantastic, if a bit large, porchetta. great vibe and beer selection, plus they have small pours!
Good food but very pricey.

Great little hidden gem. It’s a small restaurant hidden behind a grocery store. A local took me to it. It has a great selection of sandwiches.  It’s also a small bar with an even better beer selection. The prices were affordable. The food was great. The place was small but not too small. I can see a family fitting here during regular business hours.
This place is amazing. Great beer selection, delicious sandwiches, and fun little gourmet food shop. (We got the babka and it was great!)
Awesome awesome awesome! Great beer, service and vibes. Looks like a deli from outside but wait until you go in. Really cool backyard. Don't pass up, you will enjoy.
Great place to get a drink and eat inside or at the patio
Very expensive, 17 dollar sandwiches that taste the same as any other deli. I mean it's a sandwich!! Yeah the beer collection is overwhelming but again, very expensive!

A poor excuse for a neighborhood bar. Food is truely awful. Minimalist digs is an understatement. Dandelion salad, brats, "Wagyu" (HA!) roast beef, duck mousse , UGH. Off (that means old), cold, a joke, gross. What a serious bummer. Never again.

First time there and it lived up to the hype. In front, it’s a small grocery with some really good products (ie Jenny’s Ice Cream). Then in the back it’s more of a restaurant with a bar, tables and some nice outdoor seating. The iconic items are clearly the sandwiches (Nana’s meatloaf was delicious), but the baked potato is very popular as well (and ours with bacon was completely worth it), and there are some smaller bites too. Also, nice draft beer selection.
You can ask for a taste off all the beers on tap and all the food tastes like it's made with great ingredientes.
Great beer, good food

It’s MASSIVELY important to know that these guys use PEANUT OIL to fry their famous fried chicken sandwiches. As someone who is very allergic and currently having a reaction after having had parts of one, I am supremely disappointed. Guys, post something please about this. A peanut allergy is far too common for you not to place a notice about this somewhere. — 3 stars because the kitchen is open late and the bar is great. Please communicate about the peanut oil though.

One of my favorite neighborhood spots, feels like a little community in there. The food is fantastic always, there is something exciting on the beer list everytime, and the staff is super friendly. They've got a great quiet back patio - but know it closes earlier than the bar. Late night is the best time because they switch the menu to spicy fried chicken sandwiches that I dream about. The prices can be a little steeper than other neighborhood joints but if you're on a budget go for the can of beer and shot special that's better than most other places. Can't go wrong with this place.
Amazingly large beer selection and they had a kale salad 🥗
The best spicy chicken sandwich i’ve ever had. ever. in my life.
Nice ambiance. Sandwich was underwhelming and over priced. Also waited over 30 mins for an underwhelming sandwich.
Nice and cozy

My better half surprised me with this place recently and I am so glad she did!!  First off I just need to say that coming from a Brooklynite this is one of the best examples of how NYC (especially Brooklyn) has changed. The location of this place was unexpected even knowing firsthand the changing of the borough. Most would say this is all for the better but I will have to admit that I do kind of miss the old New York.  Anyhow, Mekelburgs is a gem in a Brownstone basement. I will not say "it is hard to find" or "you may miss it" because we are all walking around with GPS systems in our pocket. Just look down for what appears to be a bodega.  Upon entering you will find a deli/grocery store selling an assortment of carefully selected foods and unique (mostly local) condiments, coffee, select kitchen goods, etc. Continue through the store and you will find a bar and restaurant. What looks to be just a pretty cool hangout spot will become very surprising shortly after ordering.  I can not comment on the bar and drinks because I decided to leave that alone for the night. However, it did look as if they had an impressive drink list and from what I was told they do have a very good selection.  We shared several dishes that all somehow came very quickly with perfect timing between them. No complaints at all about anything:  1. Let me start with the epic SALTED BAKED POTATO (12.00). I never imagined a potato could be so good and I am upset that no one has put me on to this as of yet. "It's just a baked potato" you may say but this is no ordinary potato. This is a potato that could cause an Irish grandma to have a stroke. Perfectly salted and baked with smoked Cod, Creme Fraiche, and a huge mound of caviar on the side. I think I may treat this like a doughnut and call in an order for a baker's dozen.  2. Next came a Lentil Soup (9.00) that quickly disappeared. What pushes the soup over the top is the Crostini laid across the bowl. The creamy whitefish inside mixed the crunch is perfecto.  3. Up next was the best BBQ Shrimp Po' Boy (16.00) capable of putting a New Orleans chef to shame. Definitely, the best I've had. We also shared the "Mek & Cheese" (12.00) with the sandwich. I had the thought pulled from my head when I heard that the explosive flavors coming from all over may have been overpowering this dish, but definitely good none the less.  4. We decided to go to the outside area in the back to wrap all of this up with the Chocolate Babka Bread Pudding A La Mode (12.00). This being the only item on the menu as far as dessert. I guess they could leave it at this and all would be fine but I would love to see any addition they concoct to the dessert menu.  The ambiance is great. The type of place where I took notice of a couple hipsters playing chess, a small crowd watching the game at the bar, someone writing on a chalkboard wall, and a beautiful Dominican woman playing cards at an outside table.  The quality of the food is superb, the no-nonsense staff work perfectly, and if I was to own a restaurant it would be this perfect mix of great food, bar, and convenience store that some genius thought up. Kudos to whomever that may be. I will definitely be returning.
Just everything!
Fresh selection of delicious specialty foods. Only downside is it's pricey
Hot shrimp is great, and one time got it with roast beef for a surf n turf. Cool spot with store, bar, & indoor/outdoor seating. Hudson Valley beer occasionally on tap.

This place has an outstanding draft beer menu, with lots of unusual and distinctive flavors. The food is delicious and fast. They have a big selection of different chili sauces for example and so their compact grocery area has lots of unique offerings. Staff is so friendly and helpful also.
Superbly fresh inventive ingredients for a perfect sandwich

Tasty beer and food. We had the porchetta sandwich and smoked salmon tartine, which I would recommend although I did not enjoy the oyster small plate. The staff was friendly and we sampled a few beers before making our selections. There were a lot of good options to choose from. The seating is at the back of a deli/grocery store, which confused me when I first entered. They also have a garden but I didn't take a look at it.

I paid $11 for a terrible chicken sandwich that didnt come with any sides at all. It was so breaded and oily that by the time I pealed off the breading,  there was an almost insignificant piece of cheap chicken. First and last time I come here. I have no idea how this place has such good reviews.
Good food, bad service.

Lovely outdoor patio, quiet. My roast beef sandwich was delicious and had so much meat. Bartender was lovely to chat with and had good recommendations on my wine and my husband's beer. Let us try several things. Had a high chair for our infant son, and were very accommodating.

I ate here and drank here multiple times, sometimes along with friends or family. Their service was prompt, but fast service doesn't make up for their sometimes cold food and warm beer. I wanted to give this place another shot, but now with all this news about the way the owner Mr. Daniel Mekelburg who I've met in the bar and his family, treat their patrons, I can't imagine considering that my or family's safety won't be at risk, considering I'm exactly who the hate rhetoric targeted. It's a shame Mr. Mekelburg didn't do more to stop it, since I bet it was around him constantly, but i know I won't be giving Mekelburg's anymore business.
GREAT beer!
A grim, disappointing experience of mediocre food, inattentive service & a barren atmosphere. The kind of place that gets friends to write them nice reviews. Bartaps desperately need to be cleaned.
Superb. Meatloaf sandwich is fantastic.

Could not have had a better experience. Best  charcuterie assortment outside of Eataly. Honestly, friendliest deli attendant I've ever ever met. She was kind, funny, knowledgeable and enthusiastic. Also skilled, quick, efficient work. We'll definitely return.
Good, if expensive.

i ordered a po boy it did not specify having bacon or any kind of land animals I have not eaten land animals in over 5 years so this was a traumatic experience. Also in Louisiana bacon is not on a po boy I have eaten several from there so I did not expect. The cashier I asked him does this have bacon he says no and it is mislabeled.  He kindly apologized and gave me my money back but this really bothers me when a restaurant does not specify what's in the food.  Thanks for a the effort.
Great service and attention to guest needs
This is a weird place: it's a bar in the middle of a grocery store, which itself is half underground. Very expansive beer selection.
Amazing sandwiches.
Terribly overpriced - food, beer and store produce. The bar is dingy and the staff mostly are aloof and/or miserable. There are so many better options in the neighborhood.
A provisions shop & a bar, all in one!  Everything is pricey tho.
Cheese. Charcuterie. Focused small good grocer w great curation on all fronts. Sandwiches, beers and wine shine out back. Comes at a cost but delivers on its promise.
Great food. Bloody Mary's are not for the faint of heart.
Amazing sandwiches

Savory, cozy, local kitchen fare in this bar tucked away behind a specialty market. The market itself is a bit pricey and the packaged goods can occasionally be old but I love going to the bar and having the baked potato or the porcheta sandwich and having a craft beer/shot. Late night kitchen serves some of the best chicken sandwiches you can eat.
Amazing and open later than most places to get food or drinks in the area
Huge selection of beers and great sandwiches
Was denied service for being white
Great food and really good craft beer selection
Unique dining and food options. One of my super favorites. Great market in the front with international delights.
Classic unassuming Brooklyn gem. Great little grocery/bodega vibes, but you come here to eat. All the sandwiches are fire. Classic deli fare with a gourmet upgrade. Definitely a must visit.

anything from cheese to a namaste zippy cup (I need that zippy cup in my life).  We went in on a Wednesday, and the place was full. It was a fun time with lots of laughs. It was a night featuring free comedy. I have had Mekelburg's …

A great shop upfront with prepared food, cheeses, and charcuterie along with other cooking staples and needs. The beer bar in the back is cozy and friendly with one of the best beer selections in the city. There is a range of sandwiches and salads offered that are amazing and delicious along with their incomparable baked potatoes! A trip there is ALWAYS a pleasure and a good time!
Nice place!
Serve great. Good food. Nice place for lunch
Cozy
The food was great, but the portions are small for the price.

This place is another Hidden Gem. We started with a charcuterie board and that was one of the best displays of tasty meats and cheeses that I have ever experienced. The staff is friendly and helpful and they will even have a nice chat with you and tell you about good places to see in New York. Everything about this place creams New York but in a very nice and newer way.
A bit pricey, but good for a run into when you're short on a staple.
Some of the best food you'll ever find at a beer bar. Grocery store is pricey but has unique, high quality vittles.
Awesome
What a cool place! While walking to the metro, I stumble into it, sit at the bar and eat a great sandwich and beer. Definitely would want to bring a friend back
HOT CHICKEN!
Best blade for burger's

Mekelburg's is a high end specialty food shop, fine food small plates restaurant, and craft beer bar. If you like cheese, they have one of the best selections around. The restaurant / bar is hidden behind the food shop. This is a great night spot to hang. Oh!! -- and make sure to go through that door at the back of the bar. That leads to a nice little hidden outdoor seating area.  Bottomline: Mekelberg's has the best cheese counters and beer selections in Brooklyn.  Also Daniel and the staff are WONDERFUL!!!!
Variety of craft beer, good food

Mekelburg's has quickly become an institution in Clinton Hill. It's downstairs, so you might miss it. The store in front is high end, good quality, limited selection (pricey!). The bar in the back is where it's at. Great beers on tap that constantly rotate and friendly staff happy to discuss. The food menu is limited but worth exploring. Very, very good. You order at the bar and get a number that you display at your table so they can find you to deliver the food. Works ok but can be annoying when it's crowded.

The space is small but quite unique. You can definitely have a good drink here, just like a beer lab! The staffs are nice too and they won't bother to give to some small sip before your real order. Nice place, recommend!
Great little bar with excellent beer selection and friendly staff.
Love
One of my favorite places for a sandwich and a pint. The food is awesome and the tap lineup is always on point.

Super-specialty grocery store in the front, tight bar with a short list of delicious foods in the back.  Over a dozen rotating craft beers on tap (on the pricey side, but not obnoxiously so) as part of a full bar. Big, beautiful sandwiches - the porchetta easily makes any best-of list - and surprisingly interesting baked potatoes loaded with cod roe or pork belly, among other dishes. Quick service even when packed, engaging staff, and if I lived closer, I'd make it a more regular stop.
Amazing food, drinks, and treats 💯
This place is not classy, but the prices are, but it's worth it...the sandwiches are on point. Hate to say it but it's true.

This place is pretty unassuming and best visitors during nice weather. Their patio is where you really want to sit and chill. They have a great selection of beers and the food is on point. The shrimp po boy is the most delicious, spicy sandwich! And that bread pudding?! Heavenly!
Cosy little general store an bar in the back.
Kind of the perfect neighborhood spot. Great beer selection mixed with wonderful sandwiches and a nice grocery. I loved the Italian sandwich and the chocolate bread pudding.

I sincerely believe I had the best sandwich of my life at Mekelburg's, the selection of craft beer is sublime and the service good. They have a very chill outdoor space. Although the prices are elevated, you can't really put a price on true love.
Great place to come and eat or a quick stop
Hiding place with great choices of beer and foods
Neat little restaurant tucked in the back of a grocery Mart. Great beers on tap, and a solid brekkie sandwich. Pictured is chorizo breakfast sandwich and the French toast.
Great Tuesday night trivia! Good drinks. Hot chicken!
Very well curated taplist. Nice backyard. Tasty snack style food. On the pricey side but definitely worth visiting.
